results.name: Discriminant of the polynomial x^n - 1.
comment: By definition, a(n) = Product_{1<=i<j<=n} (r^i - r^j)^2, where r = exp(2*Pi*i/n). As a result we have a(n) = det(M)^2, where M is the n X n matrix M_{jk} = r^(s(j)*t(k)), defined for any permutations {s(1), s(2), ..., s(n)},  {t(1), t(2), ..., t(n)} of {1,2,...n}. - _Jianing Song_, Mar 17 2021
link: Kenneth G. Hawes, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..386
